attributes.action: NHS free access denied to tax paying ex-pats
attributes.additional_details:
Recent decision to deny free access to NHS services for ex-pats....
Any ex-pat who has a civil service pension (armed forces, NHS, education, local govt.) has to pay tax on this pension to the U.K. If we pay the tax we should have access to the services it pays for when we visit the U.K.
Govt should a) recind this decision or b) stop taxing us in the U.K.
